summary: In this context, nitrate is investigated for its potential effects on tissue oxygenation during exercise in hypobaric hypoxia. The study found that acute nitrate supplementation did not significantly improve forearm blood flow or tissue oxygenation (StO2) during grip exercises at high altitude. This suggests that while nitrate may enhance nitric oxide availability, it does not translate into improved oxygen transport or exercise performance in the short term under hypoxic conditions.
